intro: Saurauia excelsa var. xanthotricha, commonly known as the golden-haired saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. The varietal name "xanthotricha" refers to its distinctive golden-yellow hairs on the young shoots and leaves.
